Identifying Characteristics: Stems: thick, elastic, one side rounded the other flat, half-moon in cross-section, unbranched, single leaf per stem
Leaves: elongate, heart-shaped (7-40cm long), notch in top of leaf
Flowers: throughout summer, yellow ball-shaped, 5-6 petals around yellowish-green stigmatic disk
Fruits/Seeds: large seedpod shaped like barrel or vase
Other: one of most common plants in New England
Range: Native Range: Maine, New England, northern United States
